thread.title: Google has a new feature to keep you from getting bored
thread.title_full: Google has a new feature to keep you from getting bored

title: Google has a new feature to keep you from getting bored
text:
HT Correspondent, Hindustan Times , New Delhi | Updated: Sep 03, 2015 18:10 IST Every time you search for 'I'm feeling curious' on Google, random bits of trivia pops up. 
Bored? We feel you. Here's something to keep you entertained (for a while, at least). Do a Google Search for "fun facts" or "I'm feeling curious". You see that? 
Google has introdced a nifty little trick, almost an Easter Egg, that shows up random bits of trivia when you enter those search terms. Why are pencils painted yellow, for instance? (check out the screenshot above if you're, you know, curious). What was the first country to give women the right to vote? (turns out it's New Zealand). And is Saturn's mass larger than Neptune's? (Yes). 
You can see how addictive this can get very quickly especially since there's a big, blue Ask Another Question button that you can keep pressing for an endless supply of awesome trivia. 
Google pulls all this information from other websites with a link to each, so no, it won't take responsiblity for the accuracy of any of this information. But hey, it's still a fun way to kill some time. Tags
